meanings.definition: The quality of being able to be endured or tolerated.
meanings.sent1: Her bearability in the face of adversity was truly admirable.
meanings.sent2: The bearability of the pain was too much for him to handle.
meanings.sent3: Despite the storm, the tent's bearability kept them dry and safe.
meanings.sent4: His bearability in the weightlifting competition was unmatched.
meanings.sent5: The bearability of the old bridge was tested by the heavy traffic.

meanings.definition: The capacity to withstand or cope with a difficult situation.
meanings.sent1: The team showed great bearability during the intense match.
meanings.sent2: Her bearability in times of crisis inspired those around her.
meanings.sent3: The bearability of the umbrella saved him from getting wet in the sudden rain.
meanings.sent4: His bearability in the face of danger was truly remarkable.
meanings.sent5: The bearability of the mountain climber impressed everyone watching.

meanings.definition: The ability to carry or support a heavy load.
meanings.sent1: The bearability of the backpack made it perfect for hiking.
meanings.sent2: The bearability of the shelf was tested with the weight of the books.
meanings.sent3: The bearability of the truck's suspension was crucial for transporting goods.
meanings.sent4: His bearability in lifting heavy boxes surprised everyone.
meanings.sent5: The bearability of the bridge was essential for the heavy trucks to pass through.
